summary: Robert W. Genzman was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). He appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. These documents list his name, social security number, annual salary, and gross pay during the specified periods. The documents indicate his continued employment with the committee throughout this timeframe.
significance: Robert W. Genzman's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). While the specific nature of his role isn't detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll indicates he contributed to the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination.
